intro: Rhodophiala × huntiana, commonly known as the hybrid snow lotus, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant produces tuberous roots, which are adapted for storing nutrients and water in its high-altitude habitat. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
